data.title: Family friendly and they mean it!
data.text: We went here for some family game time during the day.  Food truck was available for lunch.  Seating indoors or out and the place was packed!  Several other families with kids were there.  Family type board games were inside and cornhole outside.  Local gift items available too.  The beer was great and cider was an option as well.  We will surely return and recommend.  Also, pet friendly.  This really was a family place with appropriate adult clientelle for the kids.  Great find!

data.title: Wow. What a find! A must for a beer lover!
data.text:
Great small startup Brewery. Nice atmosphere and more importantly the beer was very good.   
Compared to it's more well known Brewery, this is the one to go to. The depth of flavor has no comparison. 
Can't wait to come back. Will go around the corner to the other Brewery for a taco to go and then come here.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Great craft beer great place great service. No better place in Johnson City to watch a ball game The food trucks they use are top notch

data.title: Great beer and very comfortable and cozy seating area.
data.text:
The owner/brewer was super engaging and was very intent on getting you a beer that you would like. He also informed us of local dining options in the area.
 My wife and I really enjoyed ourselves.

data.title: Converted my son to liking stouts!
data.text: A small family startup with a great tour and a 10 barrel a batch system. The owners are very friendly and enthusiastic. Wait staff is as well.  A food truck is often on the premises.  My son didn't like stouts, but they have stout on nitro that changed his mind and now may be one of his favorite beers. Smooth and creamy and quite deep.   I had their blonde, which is an award winner.  Definitely stop in for some good times and great tastes. Have a flight and then pick your preference.  We didn't try the IPA's, since we aren't high hop fans, but they have them if you are.

data.title: Great beer, location, and service
data.text: A relative suggested JRH, and it was my first stop in town.  The brewer was the bartender and was happy to talk about beer and the community.  He even recommended local hiking and adventures.  The power went out during a storm, but the good times continued!
